channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What drove Del Monte Foods into filing for bankruptcy? Blame foodies.
item.description: The iconic canned fruits-and-vegetables brand has struggled to keep up with the changing grocery landscape, experts say.

item.title: The June jobs report showed a bigger-than-expected increase in employment. The Fed’s rate cuts are on hold for now.
item.description: The U.S. added a decent 147,000 jobs in June, pointing to resilience in the labor market. But the pace of hiring has slowed since last year as busines...

item.title: Biggest part of the U.S. economy rebounds from trade-war blues. But it’s still weak.
item.description: ISM services index returns to positive territory in June. Tariff-related inflation a big worry.

item.title: ‘Crosscurrents abound’ for stocks, but history shows the bull run has further to go, says this analyst
item.description: Swift V-shaped equity market recoveries usually deliver more gains according to Truist’s Lerner

item.title: My wife and I are in our late 60s. Do I sell stocks to pay our $30,000 credit-card debt — or do it gradually over 3 years?
item.description: “We have around $375,000 in investments in mutual funds and stocks with Morgan Stanley.”

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.
